awd_abstract_narration: This project aims to develop quantitative understanding of the                  basis for regulation of glycogenolysis, a process most certainly                carried out by multi-enzyme complexes in muscle.  Specific aims                 will be to develop useful models of complexes with increasing                   degrees of organization, along with mathematical expressions of                 their activities, so that predictions can be tested experimentally.             Models will be evaluated in terms of actual enzyme sensitivity to               effectors, response times with changes in effector levels, energy               consumption, and relationship to native glycogen particles.                     Microscopy of the scanning tunneling and atomic force type(s) will              be employed to visualize system components and the complexes likely             to occur with them.//
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA
